div.p: MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 23 Decbr. 1889

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to grant your permission for retaining the services of two lads, engaged during the current quarter for four days a week at a remuneration of 3/ and 4/ respectively per diem, for a further period of three months.
M's request was approved on 27 December; M was informed and replied the next day 'with best thanks'. The information was then forwarded to the Commissioners of Audit for their information.
See also M to A. Deakin, 14 March 1890. I found them most useful for rendering assistance in the Office and in the Botanic Museum; their wages will as heretofore be paid out of my vote for Contingencies.
